text: it's just horrible - you know when you
see somebody so close to home and to
know what your neighbor this horrible
thing this is John Ellie go with the New
York Times I'm here in South Boston and
behind me is the home of one of the
victims of yesterday's explosion at the
marathon it was a young boy
eight-year-old Martin Richard he was
near the finish line with his family and
his mother and younger sister were also
injured he was riding his bicycle they
play basketball they play soccer they
run around with their friends his father
Bill is apparently a staple and a very
active member of this community here
it's really a very quiet community with
some very large Victorian homes very
family-oriented community the scene here
is one of real sadness and despair every
now and then friends and people who knew
the family acquaintances and people who
really didn't even know them that well
are approaching the door dropping off
flowers and other mementos I spoke with
one of the neighbors James Sherman who
actually saw bill the father last night
and she was she said that she was just
completely stunned and saddened when she
found out that Martin had died I saw him
I said
Bell is everything okay his friend said
no but he was as white as a sheet
I don't know if there are any words that
I can say I don't know if there's
anything anybody can say
